#include <stdbool.h>

Data Structures

struct  ftdi_environment

FTDI chip types

#define FTDI_CHIP_TYPE_UNKNOWN   -1
#define FTDI_CHIP_TYPE_AM   0
#define FTDI_CHIP_TYPE_BM   1
#define FTDI_CHIP_TYPE_2232C   2

FTDI ports.

They are always told in the low byte of the index word if necassary.

#define FTDI_PORT_DEFAULT   0
#define FTDI_PORT_SIOA   1
#define FTDI_PORT_SIOB   2
#define FTDI_PORT_PARALLEL   3

Kind of parity format

#define FTDI_PARITY_NONE   0
#define FTDI_PARITY_ODD   1
#define FTDI_PARITY_EVEN   2
#define FTDI_PARITY_MARK   3
#define FTDI_PARITY_SPACE   4

Kind of stopbit format

#define FTDI_STOPBITS_1   0
#define FTDI_STOPBITS_15   1
#define FTDI_STOPBITS_2   2

Kind of flowcontrol.

May be activated parallel in accordance to FTDI_SIO.h by the setting the according Bits.

#define FTDI_FLOWCONTROL_NONE   0
#define FTDI_FLOWCONTROL_RTS_CTS   1
#define FTDI_FLOWCONTROL_DTR_DSR   2
#define FTDI_FLOWCONTROL_XON_XOFF   4

FTDI buffers

#define FTDI_BUFFER_RX   1
#define FTDI_BUFFER_TX   2

FTDI output pins

#define FTDI_PINS_DTR   0x01
#define FTDI_PINS_RTS   0x02

FTDI status bits

#define FTDI_STATUS_CTS   0x10
#define FTDI_STATUS_DSR   0x20
#define FTDI_STATUS_RI   0x40
#define FTDI_STATUS_RLSD   0x80

FTDI Bitmodes

#define FTDI_BITMODE_BITBANG_ASYNC   0x01
#define FTDI_BITMODE_MPSSE   0x02
#define FTDI_BITMODE_BITBANG_SYNC   0x04
#define FTDI_BITMODE_MCU_HOST_BUS_EMU   0x08
#define FTDI_BITMODE_FAST_SERIAL   0x10

Detailed Description

Declares basic FTDI operations. USB control codes of the operations have been extracted from FTDI library written by Intra2net AG for LINUX and from FTDI_SIO.H

unsigned char  number_bits,
unsigned char  stopbit_type,
unsigned char  parity_type,
bool  tx_on,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Sets the FTDI data format in accordance to given Bits, parity and stopbit type for a given ftdi_environment and port.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_enable_bitbang (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Enables FTDI bitbang mode for a given ftdi_environment and port.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Purges internal receive and send buffer of the FTDI for a given ftdi_environment and port.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_read_modem_status (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char *  status_info,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Returns the state of the FTDI modem status as a bit map in a given Byte for a given ftdi_environment and port.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_read_pins (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char *  pin_info,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Returns the state of the FTDI serial pins as a bit map in a given Byte for a given ftdi_environment and port.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_reset (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Resets the FTDI for a given ftdi_environment and port.

(Description taken from FTDI_SIO.h)

  • Sets flow control to NONE.
  • Event char = $0D
  • Event trigger disabled
  • Purge RX buffer
  • Purge TX buffer
  • Clear DTR
  • Clear RTS
  • baud and data format are not reset!

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_set_baudrate (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned long  baudrate,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Sets the FTDI baudrate to a given value for a given ftdi_environment.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_set_bitmode (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char  bit_direction_mask,

)

unsigned char  error_char,
bool  enable_error,
unsigned char  port_number

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_set_latency_timer (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char  timer,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Sets the FTDI latency timer to a given millisecond value for a given ftdi_environment and port.

The timer causes transmitting of data to the host if less than 62 Bytes are received. Exact behaviour is uncertain. FTDI_SIO says that the packet is only sent in case that at least one Byte has been received but inside the original FTDI documentation one sentence says that even empty buffer information (two length Bytes) is returned.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_set_pins (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char  pin,
bool  set_pin,
unsigned char  port_number
) 
 

Sets or clears the FTDI pins for a given ftdi_environment and port. It is only possible to set one pin at a time and only in certain handshake modes. Only output pins can be affected.

Returns TRUE if this was possible or FALSE if there were problems.

bool ftdi_usb_write_eeprom (  ftdi_environment *  ftdi,
unsigned char *  eeprom_content_base
)
